website_summaries.verdict: The Acer Iconia Tab 8's occasional buggy behavior and touch screen issues have a significant impact on its usability, and a washed-out display lets this full HD 8-inch tablet down.

customer_reviews.title: Was not the product for me
customer_reviews.text: I did not much care for this tablet. I read reviews and decided I needed a quick purchase for a tablet. I did not care for the amount of battery life and the OS was extremely laggy. Additionally, the tablet would frequently freeze mid applications and sometimes even restart it self when I was in the middle of a task. The only thing I found that I did like about it was the weight, size and expandable memory feature. Other than that I felt like I really got what I paid for with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Katie [Blu]

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is good to go, I bought it to use to fly my Drone so I would have a bigger screen without the weight of a laptop. The screen is good to go. I have always purchased Samsung products and saw that the features on this blow the Samsung away so I will update if there are any issues. UPDATE: this is a great tablet but not for drone use, it continued to lock up and freeze using the DJI Phantom Pro 3 and DJI software. This issue can lead to flyaway drones. WARNING!

I have had no performance issues and for the cost I feel like I got a great deal.

customer_reviews.author: Anibal V.

customer_reviews.title: Keep Shopping
customer_reviews.text: This device has a fast processor, excellent graphics and great sound. It also has a nasty habit of going into a deep sleep lock every time the screen goes dark which only a forced shutdown and reboot will solve. And what it doesn't have are updates. To date, Acer has refused to update the Android system because it would be too expensive for this device. Online searches will show that these are common problems for this device. It would probably be wiser to spend your money on an Android device directly supported by Google.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah II

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great if Acer didn't abandon it
customer_reviews.text: This Should be a great tablet, but it was abandoned by Acer. No updates. Here it is March 2016 and after 18 months there is still no security fix or patch for Stagefright android vulnerability. That is beyond unacceptable. It is one thing not to update from android kit kat to lollipop, but quite another not to provide SECURITY updates. And battery life on this tablet is barely 3 hours. I will never buy Acer anything again.
customer_reviews.author: V. Amador

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet but no updates
customer_reviews.text: Overall it isn't a bad product considering I got it for under $100. The 2gb of RAM is noticeable in the speed of the tablet versus my previous tablets with 1gb RAM. I don't care about the camera so it isn't part of my review. The one star deduction is that you can't update this tablet to Lollipop or Marshmallow. It seems that Acer has very little post purchase support so if you are fine with KitKat then good but don't expect any updates on Acer products.

The update has been requested in Acer forums. The response given is that there not planning any future updates for the device. Buy an Nvidia Shield instead which just received the Android 7.0 update. customer_reviews.title: Best value with hard to find features on a tablet this price.
customer_reviews.text: You can always pay more money and get something with more features, but when something matches your needs with precision and for an excellent price, that's value. With a micro HDMI output (almost unheard of on a tablet), 1280 HD display, micro-chip expandable to 32 GB, the best size (8"), and so far very reliable, it was a perfect fit for me. Needless to say, I got the Android version, though you might be able to find it with Windows 8, real cheap. I bought and returned two laptops and another tablet (LG) before ending up with this one.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible software problem

I have had problem after problem doing simple things like downloading apps, keeping it connected to wifi (my phone and computer have no such problem from the very same locations, using the Google browser, signing into apps, and on and on. This is incredibly slow and unreliable. It took many, many tries and several installations/uninstallations to get Tumblr to work properly. I am still battling to get several apps to work correctly. Thank god I received this as a gift. I would be extremely upset had I paid actual money for this schlock.

customer_reviews.title: Audio issues. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in both of them have the same issues. When I plugged in the headphone jack, the sound would come out accompanied by static that was so bad that I couldn't watch or listen to anything using headphones. also, neither one would stream Amazon music. after exactly two and a half minutes, the music would stop and would never be able to be played again without restarting the program. If you were actively doing things on the tablet while streaming music, this didn't seem to be a problem. It would also restart sporadically for no apparent reason. if you were just looking for something to surf the internet with, it worked fine for that.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Acer store for $169. (Sorry Amazon, I still love you!) Pros: Amazing screen. Fast. Well made. Did I mention fast? Con's: Poor cameras, but I don't use my tablet for photos. Some bloatware that can't be uninstalled. Battery life. Great tablet overall! Turn the screen brightness down to save lots of battery. Screen is really nice, can see it fine in direct sunlight. Strong wiifi with no drops. Highly recommended for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, convenient, and affordable, this my favorite tablet to use on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sucker for pretty things, so right away I love how this tablet looks and feels. It's slim, chic, and a lovely shade of pale, metallic, silvery white. But it isn't delicate! Although it's slim and light, it feels very well made and it's comfortable to hold onto. The display is sharp and vibrant -- the sound is good, too. I occasionally use it to watch Netflix in bed, but more often than not I'm reading on it using the Kindle app and listening to music. I LOVE traveling with this tablet. It's a great size to slip into my purse and use on the plane. It loads quickly and the battery life is great.

customer_reviews.title: not a good tablet
customer_reviews.text: First a confession: I am a big fan of Apple products and I have an Ipad2. But when I was given the opportunity to review the Acer tablet I decided to get off the Apple bandwagon and give the Acer tablet a try. The screen clarity and resolution are very nice but unfortunately the Acer did not perform well at all for me. The touch screen controls are very buggy - I found myself having to really press and hold my fnger against the screen to get it to respond. The applications are very buggy and the battery life short. My recommendation is that if you want a table, do yourself a favor and get an Ipad.
